text: Monica Seles was the defending champion but did not entered this year, as she decided to compete in Dubai at the same week. Lisa Raymond won the title by defeating Alexandra Stevenson 4–6, 6–3, 7–6(11–9) in the final. ==Seeds== The first two seeds received a bye into the second round. ==Draw== ===Finals=== ===Top Half=== ===Bottom Half=== ==References== * Official results archive (ITF) * Official results archive (WTA) Category:2002 Kroger St. Jude International Category:2002 WTA Tour
title: 2002 Kroger St. Jude International – Women's Singles
